summary: as of 24 April 2017, 1936 cases of MERS-CoV infection have been reported, including 690 (35.6 %) deaths. between 25 and 59 % of camels may actively shed the virus, providing an opportunity for frequent animal-to-human transmission in vulnerable persons. accessory proteins 4a (p4a), p4b and p5 were studied for their IFN antagonistic properties. p4a inhibits the IFN induction pathway by suppressing dsRNA-mediated infection sensing. six subgenomic fragments were reverse transcribed from viral RNA into cDNA, amplified by PCR and cloned into BAC vector pBeloBAC via primer-added restriction sites. stepwise assembly of the full-length genome was achieved using naturally occurring restriction sites. six subgenomic fragments of the genome were cloned into low-copy BAC vector using PmeI and NotI. naturally occurring restriction sites were subsequently used to assemble the full-length genome. the ORF5 stop codon is located well upstream of the body TRS of the ensuing envelope (E) gene. insertion of an additional gene immediately upstream of the ORF5 stop codon might not cause important changes in the sequence context upstream of the E gene that is considered relevant for transcription. rMERS-CoV-O4-GFP produced significantly smaller plaques than rMERS-CoV. rMERS-CoV-O5-GFP produced even smaller and more heterogeneous plaques than rMERS-CoV. veroB4 cells were either mock infected or infected with rMERS-CoV or rMERS-CoV-O4-GFP at m.o.i. 1 for 48 h. expression of p4a and GFP was confirmed by Western blot analysis. cyclosporin A (CsA) is known to include MERS-CoV. veroB4 cells were seeded in 96-well plates and infected with recombinant virus at m.o.i. of 0.1. cDNA full-length genome does not require in vitro ligation of fragments before RNA. mutagenesis was more rapid than classical mutagenesis because it circumvents the introduction of mutations at the level of subclones. the advantage of the first option is that no viral gene is lost that would be critically needed for replication or interaction with the host cell. p5 inhibits the induction of IFN- production by preventing nuclear translocation of IFN regulatory factor 3. the viral gene to which the reporter gene is fused will be left unaffected by this strategy. mutations can influence the transcription level if located in core TRS elements, in the upstream (5′-proximal) TRS context, as well as in distant genome regions. insertion site at the 5′-end of ORF4a thus allowed seamless integration of GFP. the fluorescence signal of rMERS-CoV-O4-GFP was highest at 48 h p.i. the level of viral particles in the cell culture supernatant remained constant. fetal bovine serum, penicillin/streptomycin, non-essential amino acids, 1 % l-glutamine and 1 % sodium pyruvate were supplemented with 10 % fetal bovine serum, 2 % penicillin/streptomycin, 2 % non-essential amino acids, 2 % l-glutamine and 2% sodium pyruvate. the supernatant was removed and cells washed twice with cloning strategy was based on genome of reference strain MERS-CoV/EMC2012. genome was divided into six subgenomic fragments of similar length (A1, A2, B1, B2, C1, C2). fragments C1 and C2 were amplified with primers C1-for 5′-agctttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttt the natural SwaI restriction site at genome position 20 764 was deleted during synthesis (ATTTAAATATTgAAT) all three fragments were corrected using the Phusion Site-Directed Mutagenesis Kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and again Sanger sequenced. full-length genome-containing plasmid was Sanger sequenced. integrity of the genome-containing plasmid was checked using PCRs. capped nucleocapsid transcript was generated using 1 g of a purified PCR product spanning the N gene. recombination Red-mediated recombination was done as previously described. the full-length cDNA plasmid was transformed into E. coli strain GS1783. This strain carries chromosomally encoded genes for Red recombination under a temperature-inducible promoter. Primers MERS-GFP-5-F (5′-cgcgcgattcagtcctcctcctcctcctcctccctccctccctcccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccccc successful recombination resulting in a full-length MERS-CoV cDNA genome carrying the GFP gene was confirmed. a unique restriction site was chosen (a) where the marker cassette was inserted (b) the marker cassette was then excised by in vivo cleavage at the I-SceI site and a second Red recombination (f) Western blot cells (3.5105 cells ml1) were seeded in 6-well plates 24 h prior to mock infection or infection with rMERS-CoV or rMERS-CoV-O4-GFP at an m.o.i. of 1. cells were washed once with ice-cold PBS, scraped into 1 ml PBS and centrifuged for 10 min at 300 g and 4 °C. inhibitor test Vero B4 cells were seeded at a concentration of 2105 cells ml1 in a black 96-well plate 24 h prior to infection. cells were infected with rMERS-CoV or rMERS-CoV-O4-GFP at an m.o.i. of 0.1. after 1 h of virus adsorption the inoculum was removed. fluorescence or luminescence signals determined at 0 M CsA were set to 100 %. fetal bovine serum, penicillin/streptomycin, non-essential amino acids, 1 % l-glutamine and 1 % sodium pyruvate were incubated for 10 min. fetal bovine serum, 2 % penicillin/streptomycin, 2 % non-essential amino acids, 2 % l-glutamine and 2% sodium pyruvate. cells were fixed in 6 % formaldehyde and stained with a 0.2 % crystal violet. all infection experiments were done under biosafety level 3 conditions. fragments C1 and C2 were amplified with primers C1-for 5′-agctttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttt poly (T) tail and an MluI restriction site (bold in primer C2-rev) were added to the 3’ end of fragment C2 via primers. the natural SwaI restriction site at genome position 20 764 was deleted during synthesis. all plasmids were digested at the naturally occurring restriction sites indicated. digested plasmids separated on a 0.8 % agarose gel and desired fragments purified using NucleoSpin Gel and PCR Clean-up. the full-length genome-containing plasmid was Sanger sequenced. cell culture supernatant was then transferred to susceptible VeroB4 cells. cell culture supernatant was then transferred to susceptible VeroB4 cells. progeny virus was harvested, plaque titred and stocked for further use. agtgtgaatctttttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgtttgttgtttgtttgtt positive clones were selected on LB-agar plates containing 1 % l-(+) arabinose and 30 g ml1 chloramphenicol. successful recombination resulting in a full-length MERS-CoV cDNA genome carrying the GFP gene was confirmed. cells were washed twice with PBS and fixed with 6 % formaldehyde for 1 h. slides were left to dry in the dark and stored at 4 °C. western blot Vero B4 cells (3.5105 cells ml1) were seeded in 6-well plates 24 h prior to mock infection. 4a was done using a polyclonal rabbit anti-p4a antibody (1 : 1250, Eurogentec) and a horseradish peroxidase-coupled goat anti-rabbit antibody (1 : 10,000, Dianova) the membrane was stripped of antibodies using ReBlot Plus Strong Antibody Stripping Solution (10, Merck Millipore) and rabbit anti-GFP (1 : 2000, Life Technologies) antibodies. Cytotoxicity of CsA was determined using the CellTiter-Glo Luminescent Cell Viability Assay (Promega) cells were seeded exactly as described above and treated with same concentrations of CsA that were used for the inhibitor assay.
